items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
This flood alert remains in place for the evening high tide on 15/08/2022.  Forecast high water is at 22:45 this evening 15/08/2022 with a level of 7.35 mAOD with force 3 south westerly wind. All times are local and refer to the high water time at Avonmouth. Flooding to roads and farmland is possible an hour either side of the high tide along the tidal River Avon from Sea Mills to Conham in Bristol and between the Avonmouth Bridge and Shirehampton Park including Pill and Shirehampton.  We continue to monitor the situation and our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and be careful along promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.
This message will be updated on Tuesday 16/08/2022 when this flood alert is likely to be removed as tides fall.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.64mAOD at 18:15 on Monday 15th August 2022.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is very low for this time of year at 7 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain very low for at least the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 21:00 this evening, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely between 14:00 and 16:00 today, Monday 15th August. Clacton Promenade, Lee-over-Sands and Brightlingsea sea front may see some wave overtopping and spray. The Strood at Mersea Island, Coast Road and car parks on the front at West Mersea, and the Hythe and Promenade at Maldon may be flooded. The detailed forecast for those that use it is for a peak level at Clacton of 2.73mAODN at 15:00, on Monday 15th August, which is 0.21m above tide tables, wind Force 4, southerly (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more information refer to local tide tables). Take care on coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 18:00 today, Monday 15th August.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the sea has now reduced and tidal water levels for upcoming tides have fallen below levels of concern.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from Old Hunstanton, to and including Cley
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from East Cley to Kelling Hard, including Salthouse
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold on 15/08/22. We will continue to monitor the situation and reissue the alert if necessary. Please be aware of your surroundings and keep up to date with the current situation.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message: The weather is more settled and no further impacts are expected.
This Flood Alert has been removed. We will continue to monitor the situation and reissue the alert if necessary.
